meanings.definition: To persuade someone not to do something.
meanings.sent1: I tried to dissuade my friend from eating too much candy.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to dissuade me from staying up too late.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dissuade the dog from chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds dissuaded us from having a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's warning dissuaded the students from cheating on the test.

meanings.definition: To advise or urge against something.
meanings.sent1: He dissuaded his brother from buying a broken toy.
meanings.sent2: The doctor dissuaded her patient from smoking due to health risks.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl dissuaded the young birds from flying too close to the ground.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds dissuaded the sailors from setting sail.
meanings.sent5: The sign dissuaded people from entering the dangerous area.
